title: #SecureBoot.1.0.0.SecureBoot

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.description: This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
Oem.longDescription: The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.

SecureBootEnable.description: Enable or disable UEFI Secure Boot (takes effect on next boot).
SecureBootEnable.longDescription: Setting this property to true enables UEFI Secure Boot, and setting it to false disables it.

SecureBootCurrentState.description: Current enabled state of Secure Boot
SecureBootCurrentState.longDescription: The value of this property indicates the current state of UEFI Secure Boot. A value of true indicates that Secure Boot is currently enabled, and false indicate that it is disabled.

ResetToDefaultKeys.description: If true, reset to default Secure Boot keys on next boot.
ResetToDefaultKeys.longDescription: Setting this property to true causes the content of all UEFI Secure Boot databases to get reset to their default state.

ResetAllKeys.description: If true, clear all Secure Boot keys on next boot.
ResetAllKeys.longDescription: Settings this property to true causes the content of all UEFI Secure Boot databases to get cleared, putting the system in Setup Mode.
